sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3}, B = {2, 3, 4} and C = {3, 4, 5}. Find the value of (A △ B) × C, (B △ C) × A and A × (B △ C) and verify that the set symmetric difference is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
